meanings.definition: Very small or tiny in size.
meanings.sent1: The dollhouse had lilliputs furniture that fit perfectly inside.
meanings.sent2: The puppy was so lilliputs that it could fit in the palm of my hand.
meanings.sent3: The lilliputs cupcakes were almost too cute to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her lilliputs earrings sparkled like tiny stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The lilliputs flowers in the garden added a touch of whimsy.

meanings.definition: A group of tiny people in Jonathan Swift's novel 'Gulliver's Travels'.
meanings.sent1: In the story, Gulliver encounters the lilliputs who are no taller than his thumb.
meanings.sent2: The lilliputs worked together to build a miniature village in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The lilliputs' small size didn't stop them from having big adventures.
meanings.sent4: The lilliputs' society was a fascinating contrast to Gulliver's own world.
meanings.sent5: Gulliver was amazed by the lilliputs' ingenuity and resourcefulness.
